title: 112_hr6343
content: The Act is titled the "Fort Sumner Project Title Conveyance Act" and includes definitions for various terms. The Act, titled the "Fort Sumner Project Title Conveyance Act," defines key terms such as District, Forbearance Agreement, Project, Repayment Contract, and Secretary. The Act defines key terms such as Secretary, Memorandum of Agreement, and Transfer Agreement related to the title transfer of Fort Sumner Irrigation District facilities. SEC. 3. CONVEYANCE. The Secretary is authorized to convey all right and title of the United States in the Project to the District, subject to existing rights and shared costs. Compliance with environmental laws is required before the conveyance. The Secretary is authorized to convey all right and title of the United States in the Project to the District, subject to existing rights and shared costs. Compliance with environmental laws, including the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 and the Endangered Species Act of 1973, is required before the conveyance. If the conveyance is not completed within 2 years after meeting the requirements, a report must be submitted to Congress. The Secretary is authorized to convey the Project to the District, subject to environmental laws. If conveyance is not completed within 2 years, a report must be submitted to Congress explaining the delay and stating a new completion date. SEC. 4. LIABILITY. The United States will no longer be responsible for operating or maintaining the Project after conveyance, except for damages caused before the conveyance date. Liability is limited to the Federal Tort Claims Act. SEC. 5. TERMINATION OF REPAYMENT CONTRACT. SEC. 5. TERMINATION OF REPAYMENT CONTRACT. Effective upon conveyance under section 3, the Repayment Contract ends, and both the United States and the District are no longer obligated under it. SEC. 6. FORBEARANCE AGREEMENT. The United States has no payment obligation under the Forbearance Agreement after the Repayment Contract termination. All other terms of the Forbearance Agreement remain in effect for at least 10 years after the enactment of this Act. SEC. 7. FUTURE BENEFITS. The conveyed property is not part of a Federal reclamation project, and the entity receiving the property is not eligible for Federal project benefits, except those available to a similarly situated entity with non-Federal project property.
